column4: Hello everyone, i have manually remove gnome packages from ubuntu because i wanted a command line system, its booting fine but if have to press "Alt + Ctrl + f1" to go to command line . is there any way to do this automatically , like changing runlevel or something ?
removing the login manager doesn't suffice?
, Now the size of my desktop is "726 MB" so i think i have removed sufficient  thing ...
eh, if the login manager is still there, you will still get a graphical login prompt. "sudo apt-get remove lightdm" or "sudo apt-get remove gdm" depending on your Ubuntu version.
how can gdm can reside , i have removed every instance of X server ...
then if you've removed X i really don't see why you'd need to press ctrl+alt+f1 to login textually... what do you *see* before pressing ctrl+alt+f1?
blank screen with a blinking "_" on on the top
funny. i don't know, maybe it's plymouth (the boot splash) that switches to terminal 7 or 8... try removing plymouth if you don't mind not having a splash screen
yes i have also removed plymouth themes , but when i remove plymouth it gives me warning and also try to remove mysql and linux-generic-*
tried putting "nosplash" instead of "splash" in the linux options?
same blank screen with a blinking "_" on on the top
ok just tell me how to boot to tty1 directly...
err, i would of course if i knew how
then can you please tell me who knows...
thanks for your support, the solution of my problem was to edit a line in grub.cfg --> " console= tty1" :)
oh. i grepped for "tty" in /etc/ and /boot/ but couldn't quite spot it.
